subject: RE: [junit] Re: NoSuchMethodError: FileUtils.close(Writer)
msgSnippet: Nope, it s not.  I have a copy of the ant-1.6.1 JAR on the classpath was passing in.  I removed it from the classpath (but not the build directory) but it
messageBody:
Nope, it's not. I have a copy of the ant-1.6.1 JAR on the classpath
was passing in. I removed it from the classpath (but not the build
directory) but it didn't help. It seems to add it back in. I ran
ant with the -v flag. The first CLASSPATH looks good. It is what I
set with <classpath ...> in the junit task, and I have excluded the
old ant libraries we have in the application. The second
CLASSPATH is much longer, and contains the old ant-1.6.1
library I have in my build directory. Can anyone tell me
where this second classpath is coming from? (I snipped the
actually classpaths from the output because they were huge)

(BTW, I found a work-around - I can't remove the ant 1.6 JAR
entirely but I can upgrade to 1.6.5 which seems compatable
with 1.7. But I would still like to know where this
second classpath comes from)

$ ant -v ...

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, profmezcal wrote:
>
> Is the close method being called from an anonymous or inner class?
> I know that in JRE 1.3.1_x there was a problem with this.
> Just a thought.
>

> wrote:
